title: Soviet era hotel
text: Soviet style hotel with the same vibe. Desk service was OK, not bad but also not very welcoming. The fact that you have to carry heavy suitcases through many steps is annoying. Room on the other hand was very clean and modern, very spacious. What was strange, is that there was no garbage can of any sort, also bathroom amenities were poor. But again, this is a cheap hotel just minutes from airport. Location is good, close to airport and to metro. Breakfast very poor.

themes.label: Liked: Cleanliness

reviewInteractionSections.accessibilityLabel: Mark review 1 as helpful. 0 other users found review 1 helpful.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Mark,
Thank you for your feedback, we appreciate it!
Best regards,
Helena Pazourková ( reservation dpt. )

text:
We were given a  room on the 15th floor with a lovely view of the city although you can't see the castle and Charles bridge because of the hotel's location.
A short block to the subway station.
Uber fare to airport was only about 180 koruna and takes 10-15 minutes. After 6am you can take the bus that leaves from the subway station, #119 I think.
Breakfast was forgettable.

text:
Very happy with our stay, room was clean, and plenty of space, staff was friendly and helpful and hotel is in great location for getting to the public transport or to the airport. Quite and modern, the breakfast scrambled eggs were pretty bad and the apple and orange juice was diluted to 90% water and 10% juice, so not so good, but we walked away full and happy.
I would stay there again.

title: OKAY hotel - not great, but also not bad
text:
Older hotel that is working on upgrading their rooms. The room was large enough with a small seating area and a small balcony. There is no Air Conditioning and no free parking. The hotel gets VERY hot in the summer so be sure to leave your windows open and pray for a breeze. Parking is around 20$ per night at the hotel or you can pay the same amount to Prague City and park on the streets surrounding the hotel. 
The hotel is close to public transportation both into the city or to the airport.
The beds are okay, not great but also not bad. Breakfast is also okay..not great, but also not bad.

In general, it is an okay hotel that is conveniently located halfway between the airport and the city center.

themes.label: Liked: Cleanliness
Disliked: Room comfort

Thank you for understanding why i had to explain this. Have a great weekend! Best regards, Helena ( Reservation Department )

title: It's a hotel.
text:
The hotel is a communist style building so the rooms are very no frills.  Room was adequate with balcony, typical European beds, tv, toilet and tub/shower.  Shower wand could be a little higher so you can stand while showering. The room was clean and fine for a night or two.   Breakfast was ok, some odd options like soup and cake. 

About a 10 minute walk to the metro and a 15 minute taxi to the airport.

title: Perfect, except for the phonecharging situation😀
text: The hotel is very decent. They are obviously renovating room by room. Because we have both been in "old rooms" and "new rooms:.It is our 4th stay here. Nice location.  Proffesional staff. Very clean rooms. The only complaint is that some the "old rooms" doesn't have electrical wiring fit for our modern needs, only electrical outlet for charging our phone is in one corner of the room and very far from the bed. Our advice; is that we love the renovated rooms, but even the "old rooms" would be perfect if I could charge my phone while resting in the bed. So main priority should upgrading the electrical. And the best for last: the small hotel restaurant is 10 of 10. Lovely food, nice prices and excellent staff. We never thought we would choose to dine at the hotel so often :-)

themes.label: Liked: Cleanliness, staff & service, room comfort
